content.question: Water is leaking from a dam during a particular week at a rate modeled by the function <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></math> given by <math alttext="F of t, equals, 5 plus, the fraction t over 4, end fraction, minus, the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator t squared, and denominator 5, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="F of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> is measured in gallons per day and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of days since the start of the week on Sunday. How many gallons of water leak from the dam Tuesday through Thursday, days 2 through 4 ?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
